Title of Artwork: nu couché et tête de femme
Details: The Emily Fisher Landau Collection: An Era Defined Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 ﻿Nu couché et tête de femme signed and dated 9.10.69. (lower right) pencil on paper 21⅜ by 27⅞ in. 54.3 by 70.8 cm. Executed on 9 October 1969.

Pablo Picasso (1881 - 1973) Femme à la montre signed Picasso (upper left); inscribed Boisgeloup and dated 17 Août XXXII. (on the stretcher) oil on canvas 51 ⅛ by 38 ⅛ in. 130 by 97 cm. Executed on 17 August 1932.

Property from an Important Private East Coast Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Jacqueline au chapeau noir (B. 1028; Ba. 1311) signed in pencil and numbered 22/50 linoleum cut printed in colors on Arches wove paper image: 25⅛ by 20⅝ in. 639 by 524 mm. sheet: 29½ by 24½ in. 751 by 621 mm. Executed in 1962, published in 1963; this work is number 22 from the edition of 50 plus 35 artist's proofs, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Title of Artwork: sculpteur et sculpture, from sable mouvant (b. 1187; ba. 1156)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Sculpteur et Sculpture, from Sable Mouvant (B. 1187; Ba. 1156) signed in pencil and numbered 13/50 aquatint on Auvergne wove paper plate: 15 by 10¾ in. 382 by 274 mm. sheet: 22¾ by 18¼ in. 577 by 463 mm. Executed in 1965; this impression is number 13 from the edition of 50.

Title of Artwork: portrait de jacqueline au chapeau de paille multicolore (b. 1074; ba. 1283)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme au Chapeau (Portrait de Jacqueline au Chapeau de Paille Multicolore) (B. 1074; Ba. 1283) signed in pencil and inscribed épreuve d'artiste linoleum cut printed in colors on Arches wove paper image: 13⅝ by 9½ in. 346 by 243 mm. sheet: 24⅜ by 17½ in. 619 by 444 mm. Executed in 1962; this impression is one of approximately 20 artist's proofs aside from the numbered edition of 50, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Title of Artwork: le repas frugal, from saltimbanques (bloch 1; baer 2)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Le Repas Frugal, from Saltimbanques (Bloch 1; Baer 2) etching on wove paper plate approx.: 18¼ by 14⅞ in. 463 by 377 mm. sheet approx.: 18¾ by 15¼ in. 477 by 387 mm. Executed in 1904, printed in 1913; this impression is presumably from the edition of 250 on Van Gelder (there are also 27 or 29 on vieux japon), published by Vollard.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Portrait de Jacqueline Accoudée (B. 922; Ba. 1240) signed in pencil and inscribed épreuve d'artiste linoleum cut printed in colors on wove paper image: 25 by 21 in. 638 by 532 mm. sheet: 29½ by 24½ in. 751 by 622 mm. Executed in 1959; this impression is an artist's proof aside from the numbered edition of 50, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Title of Artwork: sculptures et vase de fleurs, from the vollard suite (b. 189; ba. 348)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Sculptures et vase de fleurs, from the Vollard suite (B. 189; Ba. 348) signed in pencil etching and aquatint on Montval laid paper with the Vollard watermark plate: 10½ by 7½ in. 267 by 190 mm. sheet: 17⅝ by 13⅜ in. 449 by 340 mm. Executed in 1933; this impression from the total edition of 310, published by Vollard.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Étude de profils (B. 581; M. 132) signed in pencil and numbered 4/50 lithograph printed on Arches paper image: 28 by 21 in. 710 by 534 mm. sheet: 29⅞ by 22¼ in. 758 by 566 mm. Executed in 1948; this impression is number 4 from the edition of 50 plus five artist's proofs.

Title of Artwork: visage de marie-thérèse (b. 95; ba. 243; m. xxiii)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Visage de Marie-Thérèse (B. 95; Ba. 243; M. XXIII) signed in pencil and numbered 120/200 lithograph on Japan paper image: 8 by 5½ in. 202 by 139 mm. sheet: 10⅜ by 7⅜ in. 263 by 188 mm. Executed in 1928; this impression is number 120 from the edition of 200 (total edition is 325), published by G. Crès et Cie, Paris.

Title of Artwork: femmes a leur toilette. i (b. 1199; ba. 1181)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femmes a leur toilette. I (B. 1199; Ba. 1181) signed in pencil and numbered 22/50 aquatint and drypoint on Richard de Bas wove paper plate: 15 by 10¾ in. 380 by 274 mm. sheet: 22½ by 17 in. 571 by 434 mm. Executed in 1965; this impression is number 29 from the edition of 50 plus 15 artist's proofs, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Title of Artwork: femme songeuse et inquiète dans l'atelier de sculpture, from the vollard suite (b. 188; ba. 347)
Details: Property from a Private Collection, Ohio Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme songeuse et inquiète dans l'atelier de sculpture, from the Vollard suite (B. 188; Ba. 347) signed in pencil etching on Montval laid paper with the Vollard watermark plate: 10½ by 7½ in. 267 by 190 mm. sheet: 17¾ by 13⅜ in. 450 by 340 mm. Executed in 1933; this impression is from the total edition of 310, published by Vollard.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Le Crapaud (B. 585; M. 144) signed in red crayon and numbered 28/50 lithograph on Arches wove paper image: 19⅝ by 25⅛ in. 499 by 640 mm. sheet: 19⅝ by 25¾ in. 500 by 655 mm. Executed in 1949; this impression is number 28 from the edition of 50, published by Mourlot.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Scène d'intérieur (B. 74; Ba. 241; Mourlot XXI) signed in pencil and numbered 41/100 lithograph on Van Gelder wove paper image: 8¾ by 10⅝ in. 222 by 271 mm. sheet: 13 by 19⅜ in. 328 by 493 mm. Executed in 1926; this impression is number 41 from the edition of 100, published by Galerie Simon Kahnweiler.

Title of Artwork: tête de femme: madeleine, from saltimbanques (b. 2; ba. 3)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Tête de femme: Madeleine, from Saltimbanques (B. 2; Ba. 3) signed in pencil etching on Van Gelder wove paper plate: 4⅝ by 3⅜ in. 119 by 87 mm. sheet: 11⅜ by 9⅝ in. 289 by 246 mm. Executed in 1905; this impression is from the edition of 250 (there are also 27 or 29 on vieux japon), published by Vollard in 1913.

Title of Artwork: buste de femme d'après cranach le jeune (b. 859; ba. 1053)
Details: Property from the Estate of Eric & Ellen Blum, New York Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Buste de femme d'après Cranach le Jeune (B. 859; Ba. 1053) signed in blue crayon and numbered 13/50 linoleum cut printed in colors on Arches wove paper image: 25½ by 20⅞ in. 646 by 531 mm. sheet : 30⅛ by 22½ in. 765 by 573 mm. Executed in 1958; this impression is number 13 from the edition of 50, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Title of Artwork: femme nue à la source (b. 1093; ba. 1326)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme nue à la source (B. 1093; Ba. 1326) signed in pencil and numbered 27/50 linoleum cut printed in colors on Arches wove paper image: 20¾ by 25 in. 528 by 637 mm. sheet: 24¼ by 29½ in. 617 by 750 mm. Executed in 1962; this impression is number 27 from the edition of 50, published by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Fumeur II (B. 1166; Ba. 1166) signed in pencil twice and numbered 5/50 aquatint printed in colors on Auvergne Richard de Bas wove paper plate: 16¼ by 12⅜ in. 413 by 314 mm. sheet: 22 by 16 in. 560 by 410 mm. Executed in 1964; this impression is number 4 from the edition of 50 plus 15 artist's proofs, published in 1965 by Galerie Louise Leiris.

Property from a Distinguished Private Swiss Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Modèle au vase signed Picasso, dated 19.1.54 and numbered I (lower right) India ink on paper 24 x 32,1 cm; 9½ x 12⅝ in. Executed on January 19, 1954. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Prestigieuse Collection Particulière Suisse Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Modèle au vase signé Picasso, daté 19.1.54 et numéroté I (en bas à droite) encre de Chine sur papier 24 x 32,1 cm; 9½ x 12⅝ in. Exécuté le 19 janvier 1954.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Visage (A. R. 531) numbered 19/100 in black ink, with the workshop numbering and the Empreinte Originale de Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence plate diameter: 42 cm; 16½ in. Executed in 1965; this work is number 19 from the edition of 100. __________________________________________________________________________ Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Visage (A. R. 531) numéroté 19/100 à l'encre noir, avec la numérotation de l'atelier et l'Empreinte Originale de Picasso et le cachet Madoura plat en terre de faïence diamètre: 42 cm; 16½ in. Exécuté en 1965; cette pièce est numérotée 19 de l'édition de 100.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Corrida sur fond noir (A. R. 198) with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence dish, glazed and painted length: 39 cm; 15⅜ in. Executed in 1953; this work is from the edition of 500. __________________________________________________________________________ Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Corrida sur fond noir (A. R. 198) porte les cachets Edition Picasso et Madoura plat en terre de faïence, émaillé et peint longueur: 39 cm; 15⅜ in. Exécuté en 1953; cette pièce est de l'édition de 500.

Property from a Distinguished Private Swiss Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme peintre et modèle dated 20.1.54., numbered V and signed Picasso (upper right) India ink on paper 24 x 32,1 cm; 9½ x 12⅝ in. Executed on January 20, 1954. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Prestigieuse Collection Particulière Suisse Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme peintre et modèle daté 20.1.54., numéroté V et signé Picasso (en haut à droite) encre de Chine sur papier 24 x 32,1 cm; 9½ x 12⅝ in. Exécuté le 20 janvier 1954.

Property from a Private French Collection Pablo Picasso 1881-1973 Poisson chiné (A. R. 170) with the EMPREINTE ORIGINALE DE PICASSO and MADOURA PLEIN FEU stamps terre de faïence plate partially glazed and painted 34,8 x 42,5 cm; 13¾ x 16¾ in. Executed in 1952 in an edition of 200. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Collection Particulière Française Pablo Picasso 1881-1973 Poisson chiné (A. R. 170) porte les cachets EMPREINTE ORIGINALE DE PICASSO et MADOURA PLEIN FEU plat en terre de faïence, partiellement émaillé et peint 34,8 x 42,5 cm; 13¾ x 16¾ in. Exécuté en 1952 dans une édition de 200 exemplaires.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Personnage de profil (Jacqueline) dedicated Pour Henri Matarasso, signed son ami Picasso and dated le 13.12.60. (upper left) ink on paper 35 x 25 cm; 13¾ x 9⅞ in. Executed on December 13, 1960. Claude Picasso and Maya Widmaier-Picasso have confirmed the authenticity of this work. __________________________________________________________________________ Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Personnage de profil (Jacqueline) dédicacé Pour Henri Matarasso, signé son ami Picasso et daté le 13.12.60. (en haut à gauche) encre sur papier 35 x 25 cm; 13¾ x 9⅞ in. Exécuté le 13 décembre 1960. Claude Picasso et Maya Widmaier-Picasso ont confirmé l'authenticité de cette œuvre.

Property from a Private European Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Pierrot. Buste. dated 9.1.71., numbered II and signed Picasso (upper left) ink and pencils on cardboard 31 x 21,9 cm; 12¼ x 8⅝ in. Executed on January 9, 1971. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Collection Particulière Européenne Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Pierrot. Buste. daté 9.1.71., numéroté II et signé Picasso (en haut à gauche) encre et crayons sur carton 31 x 21,9 cm; 12¼ x 8⅝ in. Exécuté le 9 janvier 1971.

Property from a Private European Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 L'Arène signed Picasso and dated 1.6.60 (upper left) ink on paper 30 x 79,2 cm; 11¾ x 31⅛ in. Executed on June 1st, 1960. ________________________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Collection Particulière Européenne Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 L'Arène signé Picasso et daté 1.6.60 (en haut à gauche) encre sur papier 30 x 79,2 cm; 11¾ x 31⅛ in. Exécuté le 1er juin 1960.

Property from a Distinguished Private Swiss Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Deux personnages signed Picasso, dated 24. 1. 54 and numbered IV (upper right) India in on paper 23,9 x 32,4 cm; 9½ x 12¾ in. Executed on January 24, 1954. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Prestigieuse Collection Particulière Suisse Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Deux personnages signé Picasso, daté 24. 1. 54 et numéroté IV (en haut à droite) encre de Chine sur papier 23,9 x 32,4 cm; 9½ x 12¾ in. Exécuté le 24 janvier 1954.

Property from a Private Parisian Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Tête de femme (Marie-Thérèse) signed Picasso (lower right); situated Paris and dated 18 janvier XXXIV (upper right) ink and wash on paper 25,5 x 32,5 cm; 10 x 12¾ in. Executed in Paris on January 18, 1934. Claude Picasso has confirmed the authenticity of this work. __________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Collection Particulière Parisienne Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Tête de femme (Marie-Thérèse) signé Picasso (en bas à droite); situé Paris et daté 18 janvier XXXIV (en haut à droite) encre et lavis sur papier 25,5 x 32,5 cm; 10 x 12¾ in. Exécuté à Paris le 18 janvier 1934. Claude Picasso a confirmé l'authenticité de cette œuvre.

Title of Artwork: nature morte aux pommes et au verre
Details: Property from an Important Private Italian Collection Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Nature morte aux pommes et au verre signed PICASSO (along the lower edge) oil on canvas 22,2 x 16,3 cm; 8¾ x 6⅜ in. Painted in 1914. The original certificate by Pablo Picasso has been lost. The work is recorded in the archives of the Picasso Administration. _________________________________________________________________________ Provenant d'une Importante Collection Particulière Italienne Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Nature morte aux pommes et au verre signé PICASSO (le long du bord inférieur) huile sur toile 22,2 x 16,3 cm; 8¾ x 6⅜ in. Peint en 1914. Le certificat original de Pablo Picasso a été perdu. L'œuvre est enregistrée dans les archives de l'Administration Picasso.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Corrida (A. R. 181) with the Empreinte Originale de Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence dish, partially glazed and painted diameter: 425 mm. 16¾ in. Executed in 1953; this work is from the edition of 200.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Corrida sur fond noir (A. R. 198) with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps Terre de faïence dish, glazed and painted length: 390 mm. 15⅜ in. Executed in 1953; this work is from the edition of 500.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Picador (A. R. 160) inscribed Edition Picasso, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps Terre de faïence plate, partially glazed and painted diameter: 195 mm. 7⅝ in. Executed in 1952; this work is from the edition of 500.

Title of Artwork: joueur de flûte et chèvre (a. r. 382)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Joueur de flûte et chèvre (A. R. 382) with the Empreinte Originale de Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence plaque, partially glazed and painted diameter: 254 mm. 10 in. Executed in 1956; this work is from the edition of 450.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Visage no. 202 (A. R. 495) numbered 436/500, titled, inscribed Edition Picasso and Madoura terre de faïence plate, glazed and painted diameter: 255 mm. 10 in. Executed in 1963; this work is number 436 from the edition of 500.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Vase deux anses hautes (A. R. 213) inscribed Edition Picasso, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps Terre de faïence vase, partially glazed and painted height: 390 mm. 15⅜ in. Executed in 1953; this work is from the edition of 400.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Sujet poule (A. R. 250) inscribed Edition Picasso and Madoura, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps Terre de faïence pitcher, glazed and painted length: 160 mm. 6¼ in. Executed in 1954; this work is from the edition of 500.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Sujet poisson (A. R. 139) inscribed Edition Picasso, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence pitcher, partially painted length: 200 mm. 8in. Executed in 1952; this work is from the edition of 500.
Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Petite chouette (A. R. 82) with the Madoura stamp terre de faïence pitcher, partially painted height: 125 mm. 4⅞ in. Executed in 1949; this work is from the edition of 200.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Pichet Espagnol (A. R. 245) numbered 139/200, inscribed Edition Picasso and Madoura, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence pitcher, partially glazed and painted height: 200 mm. 8in. Executed in 1954; this work is number 139 from the edition of 200.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Chouette femme (A. R. 119) inscribed Edition Picasso, with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps Terre de faïence vase, partially glazed and painted height: 280 mm. 11 in. Executed in 1951; this work is from the edition of 500.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Montaignes près de Malaga signed P. Ruiz Picasso, dated Bareclona 97, and dedicated A mi querido amigo D. Hermenegildo, Montes (lower left) oil on canvas 60.4 by 82.2 cm. 23¾ by 32⅜ in. Framed: 94.5 by 116 cm. 37¼ by 41¾ in. Executed in 1897.

Pablo Picasso 1887 - 1973 Tête de garçon signed Picasso and dated 15.12.64. (lower right) coloured crayon, charcoal and gouache on paper 29.7 by 27 cm. 11¾ by 10⅝ in. Framed: 51 by 45 cm. 20⅛ by 17¾ in. Executed on 15 December 1964.

Title of Artwork: tête d'homme barbu - recto; nu assis de dos - verso
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881-1973 Tête d'homme barbu - recto ﻿Nu assis de dos - verso pen and ink on paper 18.4 by 11.6 cm. 7¼ by 4½ in. Framed: 37 by 30 cm. 14⅝ by 11¾ in. Claude Picasso has confirmed the authenticity of this work.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Canard pique-fleurs (A. R. 117) numbered 32/50, inscribed Edition Picasso and Madoura terre de faïence pitcher, partially glazed and painted height: 420 mm. 15¾ in. Executed in 1951; this work is number 32 from the edition of 50.

Title of Artwork: colombe sur lit de paille (a. r. 79)
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Colombe sur lit de paille (A. R. 79) with Suzanne Ramié's monogram, inscribed Edition Picasso, madoura and nouvelle édition, with the d'Après Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence dish, glazed and painted length: 388 mm. 15½ in. Executed in 1949; this work is from the edition of 300.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Pichet gravé gris (A. R. 246) with the Edition Picasso and Madoura stamps terre de faïence pitcher, partially glazed and painted height: 285 mm. 11¼ in. Executed in 1954; this work is from the edition of 500.

Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Femme (A. R. 296) inscribed Edition Picasso, with the Madoura stamp terre de faïence pitcher, partially painted and glazed height: 325 mm. 12¾ in. Executed in 1955; this work is from the edition of 100.

Title of Artwork: pablo picasso 巴布羅・畢加索 | musicien 音樂家
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Musicien numbered 2/2 and stamped with the foundry mark E. Godard Cire Perdue (bottom) bronze 45 by 14 by 11 cm. 17 ¾ by 5 ½ by 4 ⅜ in. Conceived in Cannes in 1961; this example executed in bronze as number 2 from an edition of 2. Claude Picasso has confirmed the authenticity of this work. ---------------------------------------------- 巴布羅・畢加索 1881 - 1973年 音樂家 款識 2/2 E. Godard Cire Perdue鑄造標記（底部） 銅雕 45 x 14 x 11 cm. 17 ¾ x 5 ½ x 4 ⅜ in. 一九六一年於康城鑄造 版數 2/2 註：克勞德·畢加索以為此作提供認證

Title of Artwork: pablo picasso 巴布羅・畢加索 | portrait 肖像
Details: Pablo Picasso 1881 - 1973 Portrait dated 29.4.45 III (upper right) oil on paper 65.5 by 50.3 cm. 25 ¾ by 19 ¾ in. Executed on 29 April 1945. ------------------------------------ 巴布羅・畢加索 1881 - 1973年 肖像 款識 29.4.45 III（右上） 油畫紙本 65.5 x 50.3 cm. 25 ¾ x 19 ¾ in. 一九四五年四月二十九日作
